DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: F. F. GUIMARÃES;Guimarães, F. F.;Freddy F. Guimarães;Guimarães, F.F.;GUIMARÃES, FREDDY F.;FERNANDES GUIMARÃES, FREDDY;Guimarães Freddy;GUIMARÃES, FREDDY;GUIMARÃES, FREDDY FERNANDES

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação [2000] em Química pela Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (UFMG), mestrado [2002] em Química pela UFMG, doutorado [2006] em Biotecnologia pelo Royal Institute of Thecnology de Estocolmo (KTH) e doutorado [2007] em Química pela UFMG. Fez dois estágios Pós-Doutorado: 1) Ente os anos de 2006-2007 no Departamento de Química Teórica - THEOCHEM da Escola de Biotecnologia do KTH e 2) entre os anos de 2007-2008 no Departamento de Química da UFMG. Atualmente é professor Associado III do Instituto de Química da Universidade Federal de Goiás (UFG). Ocupou o cargo de coordenador do curso de pós-graduação no nível de mestrado entre 2009-2011, na avaliação da CAPES neste período o curso de pós-graduação teve sua nota elevada. Tem experiência nas áreas de Química, Física e Desenvolvimento de Software, com ênfase nas Interações de Fótons com Moléculas e Espectros Moleculares. Atua principalmente nos seguintes temas: i) fenômenos físicos ultra-rápidos, ii) controle quântico, iii) espectroscopia laser resolvida no tempo, iv) teoria de perturbação dependente do tempo e v) efeitos de coerência. Atualmente possui um total de 37 trabalhos publicados em periódicos internacionais, com um total de 437 citações, Fator H igual a 12 e uma média de 12.5 citações por artigo. Além disto é coordenador de projetos de pesquisa, supervisionou Pós-Doutorandos e orienta alunos de Iniciação Científica, Mestrado e Doutorado.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate at Quimica from Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2000), master's at Chemistry from Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2002), ph.d. at Chemistry from Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2007) and ph.d. at Biotecnologia from Kungliga Tekniska Hogskolan (2006). He is currently professor adjunto i at Universidade Federal de Goiás. Has experience in Physic, focusing on Atomic and Molecular Physics, acting on the following subjects: algoritmo genetico, teoria de perturbação dependente do tempo, propagação de pacotes de onda, dinamica molecular born-oppenheimer and clusters.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Determinar através de cálculos teóricos e simulações computacionais das condições experimentais para verificação de fenômenos físicos ultra-rápidos que ocorrem quando átomos ou moléculas interagem com campos eletromagnêticos de curta duração (em escala de femtosegundo). LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Química Teórica e Computacional (Dinämica Borh-Oppenheimer e Pacotes de onda)
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: O principal objetivo desta linha de pesquisa é o desenvolvimento de técnicas e softwares computacionais direcionados ao estudo da dinâmica das interações de moléculas com campos eletromagnéticos. O software que estamos desenvolvendo permite os estudo de reações promovidas por laser, assim como, a simulação computacioanal de reações químicas na presença de campos eletromagnéticos. Os resultados das simulações computacionais mostraram, por exemplo, a possibilidade do direcionamento de reações químicas por pulsos de laser. A dinâmica de reação obtida através da interação de lasers de freqüência definida com moléculas e biomoléculas. O estudo dos processos de reações químicas é feito através de cálculos de mecânica clássica para os núcleos atômicos. Já as interações entre os núcleos (superfície de energia potencial) são modeladas cálculos quânticos de estrutura eletrônica.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento e aprimoramento do programa BODy
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto de pesquisa contempla a programação de sub-rotinas para complementar o programa BODy que está sendo desenvolvido em nosso grupo de pesquisa. Este programa está sendo desenvolvido para ser capaz de tratar problemas relacionados com sistema moleculares da dimensão da ordem de grandes oligopeptídeos, por meio de dinâmica molecular híbrida, o que é feito através de cálculos de dinâmica clássica com campos de força extraídos de resultados de cálculos de estrutura eletrônica. Para superar a dificuldade permanente e recrudescente do tamanho da molécula a ser calculada por métodos da Química Computacional o programa BODy permite a partição da molécula alvo em sub-unidades de tamanhos reduzidos que, somadas, representam o sistema original. O programa BODy será aplicado a estudos de dinâmica de processos químicos e na otimização geométrica de biomoléculas como cortes de enzimas ou fragmentos substanciais de uma hélice dupla do DNA ou RNA. Em uma das etapas de complementação do programa será feita a inclusão de parâmetros geométricos restritivos, obtidos de dados experimentais. Isto permitirá estudos de determinação estrutural de biomoléculas. Vale salientar que a metodologia implementada no software permite, também, a investigação da interação da radiação laser com moléculas e mecanismos de fragmentações discriminados por energia. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo de Reações Biomoleculares Induzidas por Excitações Eletrônicas Discriminadas na Energia
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Simular a dinâmica de processos químicos com uso de superfí­cies de energia 
potencial computadas através de cálculos de estrutura eletrônica. O principal 
objetivo deste trabalho de pesquisa e o desenvolvimento de técnicas e softwares 
computacionais direcionados ao estudo da dinâmica das interações de moléculas 
com atividade biológicas com modelos representativos de centros ativos 
biomoleculares, bem como, a dinâmica de reação obtida através da interação de 
lasers de frequência definida com biomoléculas. O software que está sendo 
desenvolvido permite a simulação de reações químicas induzidas por campos eletromagnéticos, assim como, a simulação computacional de mecanismos de reação na presença da radiação laser.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ultrafast X-ray spectroscopy with applications in molecular and material science
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The central notion of this project is that synchrotron radiation and free electron lasers in the X-ray region are not only helpful to solve structural biochemical and material science problems through use of conventional elastic, Bragg, scattering, but that a number of experimental conditions can be defined to serve this purpose using resonant scattering.
We show that selective resonant X-ray scattering gives genuine possibilities to obtain orientational and angular information for disordered matter in addition to the bond distances accessible by "ordinary" techniques. We explore present and future possibilities with ultrashort, polarized, high-intensity X-ray sources for obtaining temporally selected information at a very short time-scale. We study the role of pump-probe X-ray techniques to monitor the conformation of dissociative molecules. We study the role of circular dichroism in the X-ray region in order to distinguish protein enantiomers, and we use building block principles to monitor the amino acid content in proteins and in DNA. We propose special X-ray non-linear effects for confocal therapy and fluorescence, and laser assisted X-ray scattering with new possibilities for studying bio-structures. Very little is known about the theoretical or practical aspects of non-linearity in X-ray response and spectroscopy. With the enormous intensity of soon-to-come X-ray sources this situation will certainly change and open a very fruitful research field related to nonlinear X-ray pulse propagation. We will study potential applications of non-linearity in material science and biotechnology like X-ray ``scissors'', confocal multi-X-ray photon absorption for medical therapy, and new ways of fluorescence marking. We plan to investigate the optimal conditions for observations of Dicke superradiation in the X-ray region.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Global optimization analysis of water clusters (H[sub 2]O)[sub n] (11?n?13) through a genetic evolutionary approach
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Global optimization analysis of water clusters (H[sub 2]O)[sub n] (11?n?13) through a genetic evolutionary approach

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The structures and stabilities of water clusters (H_2O)_n with 11<=n<=13 are determined by a genetic algorithm approach with two new evolutionary operators?namely annihilator and history operators. These studies show that the modified genetic algorithm provides an efficient procedure for calculating global minima with an especial attention to molecular water clusters. The actual results are in quantitative agreement with previous calculations using the basin hopping Monte Carlo method.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The structures and stabilities of water clusters (H_2O)_n with 11<=n<=13 are determined by a genetic algorithm approach with two new evolutionary operators?namely annihilator and history operators. These studies show that the modified genetic algorithm provides an efficient procedure for calculating global minima with an especial attention to molecular water clusters. The actual results are in quantitative agreement with previous calculations using the basin hopping Monte Carlo method.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Determination of main structural compositions of nanoalloy clusters of CuxAuy (x +y ? 30) using a genetic algorithm approach
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Determination of main structural compositions of nanoalloy clusters of CuxAuy (x +y ? 30) using a genetic algorithm approach

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The structures of various compositions of nanoalloy clusters CuxAuy (x + y <= 30) were determined using the recently developed molecular genetic algorithm. For compositions up to 18 atoms the algorithm found the global minima in all five runs. For clusters with less than 12 atoms, pure Au clusters are most stable. As the total number of atoms increases, clusters with one, two, three, or four Cu atoms become most stable. It has been observed for larger clusters that there is a tendency for structures based on Cu cores surrounded by Au atoms. The calculated second differences in binding energies are in fair agreement with experimental mass spectra for some nuclearities. Finally, the extrapolated cohesive energies for nanoalloys ((Cu3Au)m, (CuAu3)m, and (CuAu)m) gave an average relative error of 11%, compared with the bulk alloys, whereas for the nanoclusters (AuN and CuN) the error was less than 6%.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The structures of various compositions of nanoalloy clusters CuxAuy (x + y <= 30) were determined using the recently developed molecular genetic algorithm. For compositions up to 18 atoms the algorithm found the global minima in all five runs. For clusters with less than 12 atoms, pure Au clusters are most stable. As the total number of atoms increases, clusters with one, two, three, or four Cu atoms become most stable. It has been observed for larger clusters that there is a tendency for structures based on Cu cores surrounded by Au atoms. The calculated second differences in binding energies are in fair agreement with experimental mass spectra for some nuclearities. Finally, the extrapolated cohesive energies for nanoalloys ((Cu3Au)m, (CuAu3)m, and (CuAu)m) gave an average relative error of 11%, compared with the bulk alloys, whereas for the nanoclusters (AuN and CuN) the error was less than 6%.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Enhancement of the recoil effect in x-ray photoelectron spectra of molecules driven by a strong ir field
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Enhancement of the recoil effect in x-ray photoelectron spectra of molecules driven by a strong ir field

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The C K and O K x-ray photoelectron spectra of the CO molecule, driven by a strong ir field, are studied
theoretically. An enhancement of the recoil effect, which results in a strong dependence of the electron
vibrational profile on the energy of x-ray photon, is found. The enhancement of the recoil effect happens due to an ir-induced increase of the wave-packet size. An extra enhancement occurs when the gradients of ground and ionized states approach each other. Under an increase of the photon energy, different sides of the x-ray photoelectron band experience blue- and redshifts, which are related to the difference of the gradients of the ground and core ionized states in the points of the vertical transitions near turning points of the wave packet. This makes the ir?x-ray pump-probe spectroscopy a very promising tool to study the shape of the potential energy surfaces.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The C K and O K x-ray photoelectron spectra of the CO molecule, driven by a strong ir field, are studied
theoretically. An enhancement of the recoil effect, which results in a strong dependence of the electron
vibrational profile on the energy of x-ray photon, is found. The enhancement of the recoil effect happens due to an ir-induced increase of the wave-packet size. An extra enhancement occurs when the gradients of ground and ionized states approach each other. Under an increase of the photon energy, different sides of the x-ray photoelectron band experience blue- and redshifts, which are related to the difference of the gradients of the ground and core ionized states in the points of the vertical transitions near turning points of the wave packet. This makes the ir?x-ray pump-probe spectroscopy a very promising tool to study the shape of the potential energy surfaces.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The principles of infrared-x-ray pump-probe spectroscopy. Applications on proton transfer in core-ionized water dimers
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: The principles of infrared-x-ray pump-probe spectroscopy. Applications on proton transfer in core-ionized water dimers

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Two-color phase-sensitive x-ray pump-probe spectroscopy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Two-color phase-sensitive x-ray pump-probe spectroscopy

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: X-ray pump-probe spectroscopy is studied theoretically. It is shown that two-color?optical + x-ray?excitation with constant phase of the pump radiation exhibits strong interference between the one- and two-photon excitation channels. This effect is found to be large for both long and short pump pulses, while the interference vanishes for x-ray pulses longer than one cycle of the pump field. It is predicted that the spectral shape of x-ray absorption is strongly influenced by the absolute phase of the pump light. A strong sensitivity of the x-ray absorption and/or photoionization profile to the phase and detuning of the pump field is predicted, as well as to the duration of the x-ray pulse. Our simulations display oscillations of x-ray absorption as a function of the delay time. This effect allows the synchronization of the x-ray pulse relative to the ?comb? of the pump radiation. The interference pattern copies the temporal and space distribution of the pump field. We pay special attention to the role of molecular orientation for the interfere nce effect.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: X-ray pump-probe spectroscopy is studied theoretically. It is shown that two-color?optical + x-ray?excitation with constant phase of the pump radiation exhibits strong interference between the one- and two-photon excitation channels. This effect is found to be large for both long and short pump pulses, while the interference vanishes for x-ray pulses longer than one cycle of the pump field. It is predicted that the spectral shape of x-ray absorption is strongly influenced by the absolute phase of the pump light. A strong sensitivity of the x-ray absorption and/or photoionization profile to the phase and detuning of the pump field is predicted, as well as to the duration of the x-ray pulse. Our simulations display oscillations of x-ray absorption as a function of the delay time. This effect allows the synchronization of the x-ray pulse relative to the ?comb? of the pump radiation. The interference pattern copies the temporal and space distribution of the pump field. We pay special attention to the role of molecular orientation for the interfere nce effect.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A theoretical study of the role of the hydrogen bond on core ionization of the water dimer
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: A theoretical study of the role of the hydrogen bond on core ionization of the water dimer

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Motivated by the interest in using X-ray spectra for probing of hydrogen bonded networks we developed a quantum model for simulations of the electronic-vibrational profile of the X-ray core photoelectron spectrum of the water dimer. It is found that the potential surfaces of the donor and acceptor O1s core-ionized states of this system display a qualitative difference. Large gradients of the potential in the core ionized state along some intermolecular coordinates combined with small vibrational frequencies breaks down completely the harmonic approximation. The band profiles are therefore treated using a quasi-continuum approximation. The weak hydrogen bonding and the drastic change of water dimer potential under core ionization is responsible for the anomalously strong vibrational broadening: 0.4 eV for the acceptor band and 0.6 eV for the donor band. The core ionization of the donor oxygen is accompanied by proton transfer which should be observable in X-ray fluorescence or Auger spectra.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Quantum wave packet revivals in IR+X-ray pump?probe spectroscopy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Quantum wave packet revivals in IR+X-ray pump?probe spectroscopy

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The wave packet revivals constitute a central concept of X-ray spectroscopy with ultra-high spectral resolution. The revival phenomenon allows to resolve the anharmonical shift or rotational structure by means of time dependent measurements and makes X-ray pump?probe spectroscopy a powerful technique to study long-term dynamics of molecules in different phases. We study the revivals referring to the X-ray absorption spectrum of the NO molecule driven by strong infrared pulse. It is shown that the phase sensitive trajectories of the center of gravity of the wave packets and the X-ray spectra copy each other.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Phase-sensitive x-ray absorption driven by strong infrared fields
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Phase-sensitive x-ray absorption driven by strong infrared fields

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In this paper it is demonstrated that electron vibrational absorption of molecules driven by strong IR field
provides rich physical interpretations of dynamical processes on a short time scale. The phase of an infrared field influences strongly the trajectory of the nuclear wave packet and the probing spectrum. It is shown that the probe spectrum keeps memory of the infrared phase even after that the pump field left the system. The phase effect takes maximum value when the duration of the probe pulse is of the order of the infrared field period, and can be enhanced by a proper control of the duration and intensity of the pump pulse. The phase effect is different for oriented and disordered molecules and depends strongly on the intensity of pump radiation. It can be an effective tool to study charge transfer processes like proton transfer in hydrogen bonded networks.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

It can be an effective tool to study charge transfer processes like proton transfer in hydrogen bonded networks.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Infrared¿x-ray pump-probe spectroscopy of the NO molecule
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Infrared¿x-ray pump-probe spectroscopy of the NO molecule

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Two color infrared?x-ray pump-probe spectroscopy of the NO molecule is studied theoretically and numerically in order to obtain a deeper insight of the underlying physics and of the potential of this suggested technology. From the theoretical investigation a number of conclusions could be drawn: It is found that the phase of the infrared field strongly influences the trajectory of the nuclear wave packet, and hence, the x-ray spectrum. The trajectory experiences fast oscillations with the vibrational frequency with a modulation due to the anharmonicity of the potential. The dependences of the x-ray spectra on the delay time, the duration, and the shape of the pulses are studied in detail. It is shown that the x-ray spectrum keep memory about the infrared phase after the pump field left the system. This memory effect is sensitive to the time of switching-off the pump field and the Rabi frequency. The phase effect takes maximum value when the duration of the x-ray pulse is one-fourth of the infrared field period, and can be enhanced by a proper control of the duration and intensity of the pump pulse. The manifestation of the phase is different for oriente d and disordered molecules and depends strongly on the intensity of the pump radiation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Phase-sensitive wave-packet dynamics caused by a breakdown of the rotating-wave approximation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Phase-sensitive wave-packet dynamics caused by a breakdown of the rotating-wave approximation

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The water dimer driven by strong infrared field is studied in the two-vibrational mode approximation. A
pump pulse excites the OH vibrational modes and creates a coherent superposition of vibrational states of the low-frequency OO mode. The solution of the Schrödinger equation in the adiabatic approximation shows a strong sensitivity of the OO vibrational wave-packet dynamics to the absolute phase of the pump field. This effect appears due to a break down of the rotating-wave approximation when the Rabi frequency of the OH vibrational transition approaches the frequency of the OH mode. The violation of the rotating wave approximation modifies considerably the interaction of the probe radiation with the laser-driven molecule.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Resonant L_{II,III} x-ray Raman scattering from HCl
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Resonant L_{II,III} x-ray Raman scattering from HCl

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We have studied the spectral features of Cl LII,III resonant x-ray Raman scattering of HCl molecules in gas phase both experimentally and theoretically. The theory, formulated in the intermediate-coupling scheme, takes into account the spin-orbital and molecular-field splittings in the Cl 2p shells, as well as the Coulomb interaction of the core hole with unoccupied molecular orbitals. Experiment and theory display nondispersive dissociative peaks formed by decay transitions in both molecular and dissociative regions. The molecular and atomic peaks collapse in a single narrow resonance because the dissociative potentials of core-excited and final states are parallel to each other along the whole pathway of the nuclear wave packet.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We have studied the spectral features of Cl LII,III resonant x-ray Raman scattering of HCl molecules in gas phase both experimentally and theoretically. The theory, formulated in the intermediate-coupling scheme, takes into account the spin-orbital and molecular-field splittings in the Cl 2p shells, as well as the Coulomb interaction of the core hole with unoccupied molecular orbitals. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Proton transfer mediated by the vibronic coupling in oxygen core ionized states of glyoxalmonoxime studied by infrared-X-ray pump-probe spectroscopy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Proton transfer mediated by the vibronic coupling in oxygen core ionized states of glyoxalmonoxime studied by infrared-X-ray pump-probe spectroscopy

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Physical Chemistry. A, Molecules, Spectroscopy, Kinetics, Environment, & General Theory

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The theory of IR-X-ray pump-probe spectroscopy beyond the Born-Oppenheimer approximation is
developed and applied to the study of the dynamics of intramolecular proton transfer in glyoxalmonoxime leading to the formation of the tautomer 2-nitrosoethenol. Due to the IR pump pulses the molecule gains sufficient energy to promote a proton to a weakly bound well. A femtosecond X-ray pulse snapshots the wave packet route and, hence, the dynamics of the proton transfer. The glyoxalmonoxime molecule contains two chemically nonequivalent oxygen atoms that possess distinct roles in the hydrogen bond, a hydrogen donor and an acceptor. Core ionizations of these form two intersecting core-ionized states, the vibronic coupling between which along the OH stretching mode partially delocalizes the core hole, resulting in a hopping of the core hole from one site to another. This, in turn, affects the dynamics of the proton transfer in the coreionized state. The quantum dynamical simulations of X-ray photoelectron spectra of glyoxalmonoxime driven by strong IR pulses demonstrate the general applicability of the technique for studies of intramolecular proton transfer in systems with vibronic coupling.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Pump-probe spectroscopy of molecules driven by infrared field in both ground and excited electronic states
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Pump-probe spectroscopy of molecules driven by infrared field in both ground and excited electronic states

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Pump-probe spectra of molecules driven by strong infrared (IR) field in both ground and excited states are studied theoretically. The role of the final state interaction becomes important when pump and probe pulses overlap, and the Rabi frequency is comparable with the lifetime broadening of the excited state and the duration of the pump pulse. Our theoretical approach is applied to x-ray absorption of nitrogen molecule and valence photoionization of carbon monoxide. It is shown that IR?x-ray pump-probe spectroscopy can directly evidence the delocalization of core hole.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Pump-probe spectra of molecules driven by strong infrared (IR) field in both ground and excited states are studied theoretically. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Coherent control of population and pulse propagation beyond the rotating wave approximation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Coherent control of population and pulse propagation beyond the rotating wave approximation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Physics. B, Atomic, Molecular and Optical Physics

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The dynamics of populations of the vibrational states in a NO molecule ( one-photon absorption) and of the electronic states in a 4,4'-bis( dimethylamino) stilbene molecule ( two-photon absorption) is studied versus the frequency, intensity and shape of the laser pulse. We show that specially designed infrared laser pulses can build selective populations of certain vibrational states. A detuning of light frequency from the vibrational resonance qualitatively changes the dynamics of populations. It is found out that the populations of the nonresonant levels follow the pulse shape adiabatically if the detuning significantly exceeds the inverse characteristic time of the change of the pulse. Depopulation of the nonresonant vibrational states leads to a high population of the resonant state at the end of the pulse. Complete breakdown of the standard rotating wave approximation for a two-photon absorption process is observed even for a rather small intensity of the laser pulse. An analytical solution for the interaction of a pulse with a three-level system beyond the rotating wave approximation is obtained, and it is in close agreement with the strict numerical solution of the amplitude equations. Special attention is paid to the population dynamics of randomly oriented molecules. The orientational disorder as well as the vibrations limit the coherent population transfer. Calculations show the strong role of the anisotropy of photoexcitation in the coherent control of populations which can affect the anisotropy of photobleaching.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.FINALIDADE: Otimização da estrutura geometrica de clusters atômicos e moleculares.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O programa MACO-2.1 usa a técnica evolutiva Algoritmo Genético para descobrir a geometria correspondente ao mínimo global. Isto é feito através da procura e classificação das diferentes conformações estruturais existentes na superfície de energia potencial do cluster. A determinação do mínimo global é baseada nas energias das diversas estruturas geométricas de um cluster de uma dada nuclearidade (número total de átomos ou moléculas do cluster).

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.PLATAFORMA: Programa escrito nas liguagens C e FORTRAN

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Processos de Colisão e Interações de Átomos e Moléculas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O programa BODy (Born-Oppenheimer Dynamics) está sendo desenvolvido para tratar problemas relacionados com sistemas moleculares da dimensão da ordem de grandes oligopeptídeos, por meio de dinâmica molecular híbrida. Isto é feito através de cálculos de dinâmica clássica com campos de força extraídos de resultados de cálculos de estrutura eletrônica. No momento o programa BODy é capaz de otimizar geometrias de moléculas e fazer a dinâmica dos núcleos para uma dada condição inicial. No programa está implementado diversos métodos de minimização como: Método do Gradiente, Gradiente Conjugado e o quasi-Newton LBFGS. Na parte do BODy relacionada a solução das equações diferenciais acopladas de Hamilton, que fornece informações acerca da dinâmica, foi incluída diversas versões do método Runge-Kutta em diferentes ordens (2ª, 4ª-5ª e 7ª-8ª). Devido aos cálculos ab-initio de estrutura eletrônica serem possíveis, apenas, a sistemas que contêm poucos elétrons foi programada a possibilidade de particionar o sistema molecular completo em sub-moléculas. Os cálculos para cada uma das sub-moléculas são feitos independentes. O tipo e qualidade do cálculo a ser efetuado para cada sub-molécula é uma variável do programa que permite a escolha de níveis distintos ou não para a determinação do campo de força. Os testes feitos, com o programa, até agora, da viabilidade do particionamento do sistema molecular em sub-moléculas são bastante animadores. Como as sub-moléculas são tomadas como sistemas de partículas independentes, está parte do programa deverá ser paralelizada. A incorporação no programa da paralelização dos cálculos dos campos de força de cada sub-molécula minimizará o tempo necessário para os cálculos de dinâmica e minimização.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.FINALIDADE: Resolver a equação de Schrodinger dependnete do tempo

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-2: Teoria de perturbação dependente do tempo

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Processos de Colisão e Interações de Átomos e Moléculas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O programa eSPec foi desenvolvido para calcular espectros de ionização e absorção com resolução vibracional, bem como, a resposta de um sistema molecular devido à sua interação com um lasers de curta duração. Na versão atual o programa também é capaz de calcular o espalhamento atômico-molecular na presença de campos eletromagnéticos monocromáticos. As simulações numéricas são baseadas em métodos quânticos dependentes do tempo, através da solução da equação de Schrödinger. A grande flexibilidade de cálculos oferecidos pelo programa deve-se ao uso do conceito de pacotes de onda.
